Go Next Send Next Cancel User Id Input Finger Task Type Input Type Gesture Expert? Data Set Keyboard Type Screen Off Options> i-Index Finger, Gesture t-One Thumb, Gesture i-Index Finger, Touch tt-Two Thumbs, Touch t-One Thumb, Touch T-20 T-40 T-80 T-160 Touch Input Gesture Input Default Keyboard Invisible Tap Keyboard Turning ON Turning OFF word-wise Turning OFF Turning OFF arbitrarily Yes No OK Enter the phrase by tapping. Try to input as fast but as naturally as possible. Begin with a warm-up. Enter the phrase by tapping. Omit the spaces between words and try to input as fast but as naturally as possible. Begin with a warm-up. Enter the phrase by gesturing. Try to input as fast but as naturally as possible. Begin with a warm-up. The entered phrase has a big offset from the intended phrase. Let's repeat. You have pressed the cancel button. Let's repeat.

File Format is 
 
(0)UserID: the id of the user. 
 
(1)Inputting_Finger: input posture. i - index finger, t - one thumb, tt - two thumbs. Participants were instructed to choose the most comfortable postures in the study. 
 
(2)KeyboardType: invisible tap keyboard (invisible_tap), semi-invisible tap keyboard (semi_invisible_tap), invisible gesture keyboard (invisible_gesture), tv keyboard with reference (tv_ref) or tv keyboard without reference(tv_no_ref). 
 
(3)TaskType: phrase input: T-20(0), T-40(1), T-80(2), T-160(3) or word repetition(4). 
 
(4)IsGestureExpert: 0-not an expert in gesture input, 1-an expert in gesture input. 
 
(5)Device Name. 
 
(6)InputMode: 0 - gesture, 1 - typing with space. 
 
(7)Trial Information: 
 
 (i)BlockNum: Block number in the study. Block-0 is the warm-up session. The data in this session should be removed. 
 
 (ii)TrialNum: Trial Number. 
 
 (iii)Stimulus: presented phrase. 
 
 (iv)IME data: retrieved from IME via private command, contains list of TouchPoints (x, y, pointer_ids, time), startTime, TypedWord (literal string of tap input), list of Suggestions, and CommittedWord. 
 Note that for gesture input, startTime is the (down event) time of the first point in the gesture stroke, and time array lists the time difference from startTime. pointCount is the total number of touch points in the current gesture stroke. 
 For tap input, startTime is the (down event) time of the current touch point, i.e., time[pointCount - 1] = startTime. pointCount is the total number of taps received so far for the current word. 
 
(v)isCanceled: if isCanceled==1, discard this trial data. 
 
(vi)editTextContent: the submitted text content for the current trial. 

#File Format is 
# 
# (0)Inputting_Finger: input posture. i - index finger, t - one thumb, tt - two thumbs. Participants were instructed to choose the most comfortable postures in the study. 
# 
# (1)UserID: the id of the user. 
# 
# (2)KeyboardType: invisible tap keyboard (invisible_tap), semi-invisible tap keyboard (semi_invisible_tap), invisible gesture keyboard (invisible_gesture), tv keyboard with reference (tv_ref) or tv keyboard without reference(tv_no_ref). 
# 
# (3)TaskType: phrase input(0) or word repetition(1). 
# 
# (4)BlockNum: Block number in the study. Block-0 is the warm-up session. The data in this session should be removed. 
# 
# (5)TrialNum: Trial Number. 
# 
# (6)Phrase: presented phrase 
# 
# (7)curSysTime: the value obtained by calling System.currentTimeMillis() 
# 
# (8)upNowTime: the value obtained by calling SystemClock.upTimeMillis() 
# 
# (9)eventTime: The time in nanosecond at which the event happened, obtained by calling SensorEvent.timestamp 
# 
# (10)sensorType: generic type of the sensor. 1 - TYPE_ACCELEROMETER, 4 - TYPE_GYROSCOPE 
# 
# (11)value0, (12)value1, (13)value2: 
# value0, value1, value2: TYPE_ACCELEROMETER: 
#	 All values are in SI units (m/s^2) 
#	 value0: Acceleration minus Gx on the x-axis 
#	 values1: Acceleration minus Gy on the y-axis 
#	 values2: Acceleration minus Gz on the z-axis 
#
 
#	 TYPE_GYROSCOPE: 
#	 value0: Angular speed around the x-axis 
#	 values1: Angular speed around the y-axis 
#	 values2: Angular speed around the z-axis 
# Detailed information is at {@link http://developer.android.com/reference/android/hardware/SensorEvent.html#values}. 
# 
# (14)IsGestureExpert: 0-not an expert in gesture input, 1-an expert in gesture input. 
# 
# (15)Device: the device on which the data was collected (e.g., nexus galaxy or nexus 7) 
# 
# (16)InputMode: 0 - gesture, 1 - typing with space. 
#
